00028 double BdkTriBin::effCoeffS(int index) {

00031 
00032 double BdkTriBin::setEffCoeffS(int index, double val, Bool_t change) {
00033   assert(index >=0 && index <= 5);
00034 
00035   // The default values come from Kalanand's entries in the BAD note:
00036   static double coeffS[6] = {
00037     1.0,
00038     35.6,
00039     -11.8,
00040     0.79,
00041     3.6,
00042     -23.5
00043   };
00044 
00045   if (change) {
00046     coeffS[index] = val;
00047   }
00048 
00049   return coeffS[index];
00050 }

00052   
00053 double BdkTriBin::effCoeffSErr(int index) {
00054   assert(index >=0 && index <= 5);
00055 
00056   // The values come from Kalanand's entries in the BAD note:
00057   static const double coeffSErr[6] = {
00058     0.0,  // c0 is fixed
00059     5.8,
00060     2.0,
00061     0.47,
00062     1.3,
00063     5.8
00064   };
00065 
00066   return coeffSErr[index];
00067 }

00072 // INSTANCE MEMBERS:
00073 BdkTriBin::BdkTriBin() :
00074   _waveFunc(0),
00075   _waveFuncErr(0),
00076   _nEventsSR(0),
00077   _nEventsSB(0),
00078   _isMirror(kFALSE),
00079   _area(0),
00080   _inDalitzFrac(0)
00081 {
00082   initWgtLists();
00083 }
00084 
00085 
00086 // This constructor sets 
00087 // p1 at the bottom left (bottom right) of the triangle for 
00088 // mirror == kFALSE (kTRUE),
00089 // p2 above p1,
00090 // p3 to the right (top left) of p1 for mirror == kFALSE (kTRUE):
00091 BdkTriBin::BdkTriBin(const BdkP2 & p1, double space, Bool_t mirror, 
00092                      const char * name) :
00093   _name(name),
00094   _waveFunc(0),
00095   _waveFuncErr(0),
00096   _nEventsSR(0),
00097   _nEventsSB(0),
00098   _isMirror(mirror)
00099 {
00100   initWgtLists();
00101 
00102   BdkP2 p2(p1.s12(),           p1.s13() + space);
00103   BdkP2 p3(p1.s12() + space,   p1.s13());
00104   
00105   if (kTRUE == mirror) { // Put p3 to the left of and above p1:
00106     p3 = BdkP2(p1.s12() - space,   p1.s13() + space);
00107   }
00108   
00109   setPoints(p1, p2, p3);
00110 }

00139 void BdkTriBin::setPoints(const BdkP2 &p1, const BdkP2 &p2, const BdkP2 &p3) {

00141   _p2 = p2;
00142   _p3 = p3;
00143   calcMinMax();
00144   calcArea();

00148 
00149 void BdkTriBin::calcWaveFunc(double mDratioSRtoSB) {
00150   // the factorSB is the product of mDratioSRtoSB and the ratio of 
00151   // the bin's area() to the area of the corresponding sideband bin.
00152   // At this point we take this ratio to be 1, so:
00153   double factorSB = mDratioSRtoSB; 
00154   _waveFunc = 
00155     sqrt((_nEventsSR - _nEventsSB * factorSB) 
00156          / efficiency() / area()
00157          );
00158   
00159   _waveFuncErr = 1.0 / (2.0 * _waveFunc * area() * efficiency())
00160     * sqrt(_nEventsSR + factorSB * factorSB * _nEventsSB);
00161 }
00162

00164 
00165 const BdkP2 BdkTriBin::center() const {
00166   double x = (_p1.s12() + _p2.s12() + _p3.s12())/3;
00167   double y = (_p1.s13() + _p2.s13() + _p3.s13())/3;
00168   return BdkP2(x, y);
00169 }

00171 
00172 BdkTriBin::InDalitzCode  BdkTriBin::inDalitzStat() const {
00173   Bool_t p1In = BdkDP::inDalitz(_p1);
00174   Bool_t p2In = BdkDP::inDalitz(_p2);
00175   Bool_t p3In = BdkDP::inDalitz(_p3);
00176 
00177   if (kFALSE == p1In &&
00178       kFALSE == p2In &&
00179       kFALSE == p3In) {
00180     return NONE;
00181   }
00182   
00183   if (kFALSE == p1In ||
00184       kFALSE == p2In ||
00185       kFALSE == p3In) {
00186     return SOME;
00187   }
00188   
00189   return ALL;
00190 }

00193 
00194 void BdkTriBin::calcArea(Bool_t verbose, Bool_t drawPoints) {
00195   if (kTRUE == verbose) {
00196     cout << "calcArea() called for bin " << *this << endl;
00197   }
00198   
00199   // First, calculate the "naive" area:
00200   _area = (_max.s12() - _min.s12()) * (_max.s13() - _min.s13()) / 2;
00201 
00202   if (0 == _area) {
00203     return;
00204   }
00205 
00206   // check if the bin is in/out of the DP:
00207   InDalitzCode in = inDalitzStat();
00208   switch(in) {
00209   case NONE:
00210     if (kTRUE == verbose) {
00211       cout << "bin is outside the DP, area=" << 0 << endl;
00212     }
00213     _inDalitzFrac = 0;
00214     _area = 0;    // the entire bin is outside the DP
00215     return;      
00216   case ALL:
00217     if (kTRUE == verbose) {
00218       cout << "bin is inside the DP, area=" << _area << endl;
00219     }
00220     _inDalitzFrac = 1.0;
00221     return;    // the entire bin is inside the DP
00222   default:
00223     // calculate the fraction of the bin that's within the DP. We
00224     // sample points inside the bin and check what fraction of points
00225     // is inside the DP.
00226 
00227     int nPointsIn = 0;
00228     /*
00229       // calculate using random points. This is much slower:
00230       for (int i = 0; i < calcAreaNPoints(); ++i) {
00231       BdkP2 point = generatePoint();
00232       if (BdkDP::inDalitz(point)){
00233       ++nPointsIn; // count # of points inside the DP
00234       }      
00235     }
00236     */
00237     int nPoints = 0;
00238     const int nSteps = calcAreaNSteps();
00239     const double step = (_max.s12() - _min.s12()) / nSteps;
00240 
00241     // Do the loop on the x points:
00242     for (int i = 1; i <= nSteps; ++i) {
00243       double x = _min.s12() + i * step; // first assume not mirror
00244       if (_isMirror) {  
00245         x = _max.s12() - i * step;      // from right to left for a mirror bin
00246       }
00247       // The y loop. The max on j is easy to understand if one thinks
00248       // of a non-mirror bin with x starting from the left:
00249       for (int j = 1; j <= nSteps - i - 1; ++j) { 
00250         ++nPoints;   // count # of points checked
00251         double y = _min.s13() + j * step;  // for a non-mirror bin
00252         if (_isMirror) {
00253           y = _max.s13() - j * step; // from top to bottom for a mirror bin
00254         }
00255 
00256         BdkP2 point(x,y);
00257         if (BdkDP::inDalitz(point)) {
00258           ++nPointsIn;  // count this point as inside the DP
00259         }                         
00260 
00261         if (drawPoints) {
00262           // Draw the point:
00263           if (BdkDP::inDalitz(point)) {
00264             point.Draw(kBlack);
00265           }
00266           else {
00267             point.Draw(kRed);
00268           }
00269         } // end if to draw the point
00270       } // end loop on j (=y)
00271     } // end loop on i (=x)
00272 
00273     _inDalitzFrac = (float)nPointsIn / nPoints;
00274 
00275     if (verbose) {
00276       cout << "A fraction " << _inDalitzFrac << " of bin is inside the DP."
00277            << endl;
00278     }
00279 
00280     _area *= _inDalitzFrac;
00281   }
00282 }

00285 
00286 void BdkTriBin::writeName(double relSize) const {
00287   if (0 == _name.Length()) {
00288     return;
00289   }
00290 
00291   const double size = (_max.s12() - _min.s12()) * relSize;
00292 
00293   BdkP2 cen = center();
00294   double x = cen.s12();
00295   double y = cen.s13();
00296 
00297   TPaveText * text = new TPaveText(x - size, y - size, x + size, y + size);
00298 
00299   text->AddText(_name);
00300   text->SetLineWidth(0);
00301   text->SetFillColor(10);
00302   text->SetMargin(0);
00303   text->Draw();
00304 }

00308 void BdkTriBin::Draw(int color, int width, Bool_t tagLines,
00309                      Bool_t doWriteName) const {
00310   int solid = 1;
00311   int dashed = 2;
00312   int dotted = 3;
00313 
00314   if (kFALSE == tagLines){
00315     dashed = solid;
00316     dotted = solid;
00317   }
00318 
00319   BdkDP::line(_p1, _p2, color, width, solid);
00320   BdkDP::line(_p1, _p3, color, width, dashed);
00321   BdkDP::line(_p2, _p3, color, width, dotted);
00322 
00323   if (doWriteName) {
00324     writeName();
00325   }
00326 }

00365 
00366 bool BdkTriBin::operator==(const BdkTriBin & bin) const {
00367   // Bins are defined as identical even if the order of their points
00368   // is not the same. So it's enough to check their center point and size:
00369   return (center() == bin.center()  &&
00370           fabs(area() - bin.area()) < BdkDP::tolerance());
00371 }

00374 
00375 std::vector<BdkTriBin> BdkTriBin::divide(bool createName) const {
00376   // Divide into four bins:
00377   // Start by finding the middle points along each line:
00378   BdkP2 mid12((_p1.s12() + _p2.s12())/2, (_p1.s13() + _p2.s13())/2);
00379   BdkP2 mid13((_p1.s12() + _p3.s12())/2, (_p1.s13() + _p3.s13())/2);
00380   BdkP2 mid23((_p2.s12() + _p3.s12())/2, (_p2.s13() + _p3.s13())/2);
00381 
00382   TString name1, name2, name3, name4;
00383   if (kTRUE == createName) {
00384     name1 = _name + ".div1";
00385     name2 = _name + ".div2";
00386     name3 = _name + ".div3";
00387     name4 = _name + ".div4";
00388   }
00389 
00390   // Then use them to create the bins:
00391   BdkTriBin bin1(_p1, mid12, mid13, name1);
00392   BdkTriBin bin2(_p2, mid12, mid23, name2);
00393   BdkTriBin bin3(_p3, mid13, mid23, name3);
00394   BdkTriBin bin4(mid12, mid13, mid23, name4);
00395 
00396   std::vector<BdkTriBin> result;
00397   result.push_back(bin1);
00398   result.push_back(bin2);
00399   result.push_back(bin3);
00400   result.push_back(bin4);
00401 
00402   return result;
00403 }

00406 
00407 
00408 void BdkTriBin::calcMinMax() {
00409   // Find the square boundaries of the triangle:
00410   const BdkP2 * points[3] = {&_p1, &_p2, &_p3};
00411 
00412   // start by setting _min and _max to _p1
00413   _min = _p1;
00414   _max = _p1;
00415   
00416   int p;
00417   for (p = 1; p < 3; ++p){ // then loop over _p2 and _p3 only
00418     if (_max.s12() < points[p]->s12()) {
00419       _max.setS12(points[p]->s12());
00420     }
00421     if (_max.s13() < points[p]->s13()) {
00422       _max.setS13(points[p]->s13());
00423     }
00424     if (_min.s12() > points[p]->s12()) {
00425       _min.setS12(points[p]->s12());
00426     }
00427     if (_min.s13() > points[p]->s13()) {
00428       _min.setS13(points[p]->s13());
00429     }
00430   }
00431 
00432   // See if it's a mirrored triangle, meaning that only one point has the 
00433   // minimum x, and two points have the maximum y:
00434   int nMinX = 0;
00435   for (p = 0; p < 3; ++p){ // now loop over all 3 points
00436     if (fabs(points[p]->s12() - _min.s12()) < BdkDP::tolerance()) {
00437       ++nMinX;
00438     }
00439   }
00440 
00441   switch(nMinX) {
00442   case 1: _isMirror = kTRUE; break;
00443   case 2: _isMirror = kFALSE; break;
00444   default:
00445     std::cerr 
00446       << "**** ERROR: BdkTriBin::calcMinMax(): Can't determine if mirrored." 
00447       << std::endl
00448       << *this << std::endl;
00449     assert(0);
00450   }
00451 
00452   // Check that the lengths of the 2 sides are equal.
00453   // Since min and max may be the result of a floating-point
00454   // calculation (if the bin is the result of a symmetry operation
00455   // on another bin), need to allow for finite resolution:
00456   if (fabs((_max.s12() - _min.s12()) -
00457            (_max.s13() - _min.s13())) > BdkDP::tolerance()) {
00458     std::cerr 
00459       << "**** ERROR: BdkTriBin::calcMinMax(): Two sides are not equal:"
00460       << _max.s12() - _min.s12() << " != " << _max.s13() - _min.s13()
00461       << std::endl
00462       << *this << std::endl;
00463     assert(0);
00464   }
00465 }
00466 
00467 
00468 
00469 Bool_t BdkTriBin::contains(const BdkP2 & point) const {
00470   // First see if the point is in the enclosing square:
00471   if (point.s12() > _max.s12() || point.s12() < _min.s12() ||
00472       point.s13() > _max.s13() || point.s13() < _min.s13()) {
00473     return kFALSE;
00474   }
00475 
00476   // If we're here, it's in the square. See on which side of the 
00477   // diagonal line it is:
00478   if (_max.s13() - point.s13() < point.s12() - _min.s12()) {
00479     // Then point is above the diagonal, and is contained if _isMirror:
00480     if (_isMirror) {
00481       return kTRUE;
00482     }
00483     else {
00484       return kFALSE;
00485     }
00486   }
00487   else {
00488     // Then point is below the diagonal, and is contained if !_isMirror:
00489     if (_isMirror) {
00490       return kFALSE;
00491     }
00492     else {
00493       return kTRUE;
00494     }
00495   }
00496 }

00503 
00504 ostream & operator<<(ostream & ostr, const BdkTriBin & bin) {
00505   ostr << "BdiTriBin \"" << bin.name() << "\":" << endl
00506        << "  p1="
00507        << bin.p1() << ", p2=" << bin.p2() << ", p3=" << bin.p3() << endl
00508        << "  min=" << bin.min() << ", max=" << bin.max() << ", isMirror=";
00509 
00510   if (bin.isMirror()) {
00511     ostr << "true";
00512   }
00513   else {
00514     ostr << "false";
00515   }
00516   
00517   ostr << endl << "  waveFunc=" << bin.waveFunc() 
00518        << ", waveFuncErr=" << bin.waveFuncErr()
00519        << ", nEventsSR=" << bin.nEventsSR() 
00520        << ", nEventsSB=" << bin.nEventsSB() 
00521        << endl
00522        << "  inDalitzFrac=" << bin.inDalitzFrac()
00523        << ", area=" << bin.area() << endl;
00524 
00525   return ostr;
00526 }

00529 
00530 
00531 BdkP2 BdkTriBin::generatePoint() const {
00532   static TRandom3 rand;  // static so it continues the seed sequence
00533   // Generate a point inside the covering box and return it if it is 
00534   // contained in the triangle. This has an efficiency of 50%, but it
00535   // is necessary for preventing a bias in the point density:
00536   while(1) {
00537     double x = rand.Uniform(_min.s12(), _max.s12());
00538     double y = rand.Uniform(_min.s13(), _max.s13());
00539     BdkP2 point(x,y);
00540     if (contains(point)) {
00541       return point;
00542     }
00543   }
00544 }
00545 
00546 
00547 double BdkTriBin::efficiency() const {
00548   BdkP2 cen = center();
00549   const double x = cen.s12(); // define for easier reading
00550   const double y = cen.s13();
00551   
00552   double value 
00553     = effCoeffS(0) 
00554     + effCoeffS(1) * (x + y)
00555     + effCoeffS(2) * (x*x + y*y)
00556     + effCoeffS(3) * (x*x*x + y*y*y)
00557     + effCoeffS(4) * (x*x * y + y*y * x)
00558     + effCoeffS(5) * x * y;
00559   
00560   return value;
00561 }
